p: Subjects aged 15–19 years might have been fully vaccinated. Subjects aged 20–44 years who were born between 1968 and 1992 should have been vaccinated including annual boosters during their childhood. Subjects aged 45–59 years who were born between 1953 and 1967 may have been vaccinated, but there was a limited quantity of the vaccine after its first introduction in 1967. The subjects aged 60 years above who were born before 1952 were never vaccinated in childhood because the JE immunization program had not yet been introduced [ 6].
